def.dt: :to blame (someone) for something wrong or illegal :to say that someone is guilty of a fault or crime He was unjustly accused. often + of He was accused of stealing the money. His children have accused him of neglect. You can't accuse him of being rude: he's always extremely polite. She has been accused of murder. = She stands accused of murder. sometimes used humorously No one could ever accuse him of being overly modest. [=he is not modest]

utxt.vi: She deserves the chance to meet/confront her accuser.
She gave him a very accusing look.
The governor pointed an accusing finger at the legislature [=said the legislature was to blame] for failing to approve her budget.
“What did you do?” he asked accusingly.
